intro: Adenoropium forsskaolii, commonly known as the Arabian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers with five petals, typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Adenoropium forsskaolii is also notable for its milky sap, which is characteristic of many plants in its family.
